means: 按比例（或平均）分配（利润等）
平均：作为或达到一个中间值

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些形容词均含"中等的，平均的，适中的"之意。
means: medium ： 指按照某种标准来说是适中或中等的。这种标准可以是通过仪器测量而来，也可能是凭经验而得出。
mediam ： 指中间位置的，统计学上指处于中间位置的一个数的。
average ： 通常用来形容优劣难分的平庸或折衷情况，也指理论上的平均标准。

word_mean: 货物在海运中受到的损失。

sentence.Network_en: The average commuter journey there is five hours long.
sentence.Network_cn: 那里的通勤一族平均上下班要花5个小时。

sentence.Network_en: In 1970 the average size of a French farm was 19 hectares.
sentence.Network_cn: 1970年，法国农场的平均规模为19公顷。

sentence.Network_en: Its profits are rising four times faster than the average company.
sentence.Network_cn: 它的利润增长速度比一般公司快4倍。

means.word_mean: 一般的,普通的
中等的
其他释义
平均数;普通;中等
其他释义

derivation.yuyuan_name: late 15th cent.: from French avarie 'damage to ship or cargo', earlier 'customs duty', from Italian avaria, from Arabic awār 'damage to goods'; the suffix -age is on the pattern of damage. Originally denoting a duty payable by the owner of goods to be shipped, the term later denoted the financial liability from goods lost or damaged at sea, and specifically the equitable apportionment of this between the owners of the vessel and of the cargo (late 16th cent.); this gave rise to the general sense of calculating the mean (mid 18th cent.)

entry.def: An average is the result that you get when you add two or more numbers together and divide the total by the number of numbers you added together.

example.ex: Take the average of those ratios and multiply by a hundred.
example.tran: 算出那些比率的平均值再乘以100。

entry.def: You use average to refer to a number or size that varies but is always approximately the same.

example.ex: It takes an average of ten weeks for a house sale to be completed.
example.tran: 售出一幢房子平均需要10周的时间。

entry.def: An average person or thing is typical or normal.

example.ex: The average adult man burns 1,500 to 2,000 calories per day...
example.tran: 普通成年男子每天消耗的热量为1,500到2,000卡路里。

example.ex: Packaging is about a third of what is found in an average British dustbin.
example.tran: 英国垃圾桶里平均约有1/3是产品包装。

entry.def: An amount or quality that is the average is the normal amount or quality for a particular group of things or people.

example.ex: Most areas suffered more rain than usual, with Northern Ireland getting double the average for the month.
example.tran: 大部分地区降雨超过通常水平，北爱尔兰地区本月的降水量则为平均值的两倍。

entry.def: Something that is average is neither very good nor very bad, usually when you had hoped it would be better.
To average a particular amount means to do, get, or produce that amount as an average over a period of time.

example.tran: 我们的平均时速是每小时42英里。

entry.def: You say on average or on an average to indicate that a number is the average of several numbers.

example.ex: American shares rose, on average, by 38%...
example.tran: 美国股票价格平均上涨了38％。

example.ex: On an average we would be spending £300 per day.
example.tran: 平均下来，我们每天要花费300英镑。

entry.def: If you say that something is true on average, you mean that it is generally true.

example.ex: On average, American firms remain the most productive in the world.
example.tran: 总体来讲，美国公司在全球范围内还是产值最高。

means.word_mean: 1. a statistic describing the location of a distribution;

sentences.sentence: "it set the norm for American homes"

means.word_mean: 1. amount to or come to an average, without loss or gain;

sentences.sentence: "The number of hours I work per work averages out to 40"

means.word_mean: 2. achieve or reach on average;
3. compute the average of
1. approximating the statistical norm or average or expected value;

sentences.sentence: "the average income in New England is below that of the nation"

means.word_mean: 2. lacking special distinction, rank, or status; commonly encountered;

sentences.sentence: "the ordinary (or common) man in the street"

means.word_mean: 3. of no exceptional quality or ability;

sentences.sentence: "only a fair performance of the sonata"
"the caliber of the students has gone from mediocre to above average"

means.word_mean: 4. around the middle of a scale of evaluation of physical measures;
5. relating to or constituting the most frequent value in a distribution;

sentences.sentence: "the modal age at which American novelists reach their peak is 30"

means.word_mean: 6. relating to or constituting the middle value of an ordered set of values (or the average of the middle two in an even-numbered set);

sentences.sentence: "the median income for the year was $15,000"

auth_sentence.res_content: For an average northerner it is a double jeopardy.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: For an average northerner it is a double jeopardy.

auth_sentence.content: Conversely, warmer than average across much of Madagascar.
auth_sentence.res_content: Conversely, warmer than average across much of Madagascar.

auth_sentence.content: The abuse and praise I get is it average?
auth_sentence.res_content: The abuse and praise I get is it average?

Sentence.sentence: Books—especially books the average person could afford—haven't been around long enough to produce evolutionary change in humans.
The shortcomings of traditional print edition textbooks are obvious: For starters they're heavy, with the average physics textbook weighing 3.06 pounds.
They're also expensive, especially when you factor in the average college student's limited budget, typically costing hundreds of dollars every semester
The average monarch lives about nine month.

means.word_mean: 平常的, 普通的, 一般的

sentences.en: There was nothing special about the meal; it was average.
sentences.cn: 饭菜没什么特别, 挺平常的。

means.word_mean: 平均; 平均数

sentences.en: An average of 1500 persons pass here every day.
sentences.cn: 每天平均有1500个人经过此地。

sentences.en: He spends on the average two hours a day on reading.
sentences.cn: 他平均每天用两小时读书。

means.word_mean: 求…的平均数,计算出…的平均数

sentences.en: If you average 4, 5 and 9, you get 6.
sentences.cn: 如果你求4, 5和9的平均数, 得6。

sentences.en: We average eight hours' work a day.
sentences.cn: 我们每天平均工作八小时。

means.word_mean: 对…做出总的评价(或评估)

sentences.en: The attendants at the festival was averaged at about one hundred persons.
sentences.cn: 参加节庆的人大约有百人之众。

means.word_mean: 按比例(或平均)分配(利润等)，均分(利益等)；平均分担(损失等)

sentences.en: They averaged the loss among themselves.

means.word_mean: 平均为, 平均达

jushi.english: He finished school with an A average.
In western Europe, a 7-to 8-hour working day is about the average.
jushi.chinese: 在西欧,每天工作7至8小时基本上属于平均水平。

jushi.english: The quality of candidates was below average.
jushi.chinese: 候选人的素质低于一般标准。
